name: Going to the Sun Road
description: Considered one of the United States' most beautiful scenic drives, this official route through Glacier National Park enchants many visitors every year and passes through Logan Pass.

name: Chief Mountain International Highway
description: Climbing over glacial debris and through beautiful pine forests, this road offers beautiful views of Chief Mountain—a sacred site for the Blackfeet Tribe. Crossing the international border, you're afforded a view of Mount Cleveland, the highest peak in the Waterton-Glacier International Peace Park at 10,466 feet.
tips: The road is closed from mid-September to mid-May.

name: Marias Pass
description: One of the two official scenic driving routes within Glacier National Park that enchants many visitors every year.

name: Going-to-the-Sun Road
description: An engineering marvel and National Historic Landmark that takes visitors through the heart of the pass, past the Garden Wall, and across the Continental Divide at Logan Pass.
tips: Free shuttle system available early July to early September.
Entire road is typically only open mid-June to mid-September.

name: Logan Pass
description: A recognized scenic route within the park, typically accessed via the Going-to-the-Sun Road, providing spectacular high-elevation views.

name: Lake Koocanusa Scenic Byway
description: Follows the Kootenai River and Lake Koocanusa along Highway 37 between Libby and Eureka, offering access to blue-ribbon fishing and the Libby Dam.
tips: The west side route (FDR 228) is closed during winter.
Stop at Libby Dam Visitor Center for a guided tour.

name: Looking Glass Road
description: A curvy road (Highway 49) located on the Blackfeet Reservation providing beautiful views looking into Two Medicine and high wildlife viewing potential.
tips: Respect wildlife and keep your distance.

name: Seeley-Swan Scenic Drive
description: A meandering drive through Swan Valley and Seeley Valley between the Bob Marshall Wilderness and Mission Mountains, passing hundreds of lakes.
highlights: Alpine Artisans' Tour of the Arts
tips: Watch for deer and elk crossing the road often.

name: Skalkaho Highway
description: A primitive seasonal road (Highway 38) linking Hamilton and Philipsburg through the Sapphire Mountains, featuring narrow curves and a waterfall.
tips: Trailers are not recommended due to narrow curves.
Road is not plowed in winter; popular for snowmobiling then.

name: St. Regis-Paradise Scenic Byway
description: An alternate route to Glacier National Park and Flathead Lake featuring terrain ranging from rolling flats to steep canyon walls.
tips: Slow down and enjoy the blend of wilderness and civilization.
Good area for fishing in the Clark Fork River.

name: US Highway 2
description: A two-lane highway winding along the southern border of Glacier National Park between East and West Glacier, offering unique wildlife viewing.
highlights: Middle Fork of the Flathead River
tips: April to August are the best months to view goats at the lick.
A short paved path leads to an observation stand.

name: Yaak Loop Scenic Tour
description: A route through the heart of the Yaak Valley in northwest Montana, characterized by dense wilderness and waterfalls.
tips: Area is filled with wildlife; drive cautiously.
